citation.article-title: Psychrobacter immobilis gen. nov., sp. nov.: genospecies composed of Gram-negative, aerobic, oxidase-positive coccobacilli.

p.s: Description of Psychrobacter immobilis sp. nov.
Psychrobacter immobilis (im.mo'bi.lis. L. adj. immobilis motionless)
Strain A351T is a plump coccobacillus frequently showing diploforms.
It grows at temperatures from 5 to 25°C but fails to grow at 35 to 37°C.
Acid is formed aerobically from glucose, mannose, galactose, arabinose, xylose, and rhamnose but is not formed from fructose, maltose, or sucrose.
Starch, gelatin, and serum are not hydrolyzed.
Indole and H2S are not produced.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA from strain A351T is 45 mol%.

Extensive studies of the properties of nine strains of P. immobilis ( 5 ) have shown that most of them form acid aerobically from glucose and from several other sugars, deaminate phenylalanine and tryptophan, contain urease, reduce nitrate, and hydrolyze Tween 80.
None of the strains examined was able to form acid from fructose or sucrose or to hydrolyze starch (5).
Many psychrobacters have been found to be competent for genetic transformation (20).
The DNA base composition was found to be 46 mol% guanine plus cytosine for strains ATCC 17955 and MJT F5/199A and 44 mol% guanine plus cytosine for strain ATCC 15174.
